structure.I_vespers: All from the Proper or Common
structure.matins: All from the Proper or Common, with Te Deum
structure.lauds: All from the Proper or Common, with festive psalms p. 221
structure.prime: Antiphon of the feast; psalms 53, 118.1, 118.2; chapter and rest per rubrics (p. LXIX); short lesson of the season (p. LXX)
structure.terce_sext_none: Antiphons of feast, psalms of Sunday; rest from Proper or Common

structure.prime: Antiphon and psalms of weekday (pp. 279A ff.); chapter and rest as per rubrics (p. LXIX); short lesson of season
structure.terce_sext_none: Antiphons and psalms of weekday occurring; rest of feast from Proper or Common

structure.vespers: Antiphons and psalms of weekday occurring (pp. 280 ff.), unless feast has proper antiphons; rest from Proper or Common
structure.compline: Antiphons and psalms of weekday occurring (pp. 283 ff.); rest as on Sunday (p. 266)

intro.note: Mass rules concern sung Mass only, conventual or not.

prime.short_lesson: Dominus autem (used at every Office until Saturday after Ash Wednesday inclusive)

January.feast: St. Paul the First Hermit, Confessor

January.office: Ferial; or Me exspectaverunt with proper prayers

January.feast: Conversion of St. Paul the Apostle
notes: Commemoration of St. Peter per general rule (see p. LVIII).
At Compline: antiphons & psalms of weekday (p.283 ff.).

January.feast: St. John Chrysostom, Bishop, Confessor, Doctor
St. Francis de Sales, Bishop, Confessor, Doctor

vespers.rule: On Saturday: Vespers of following feast; no commemoration of Sunday or preceding feast.

February.feast: Purification of the BVM (Presentation of the Lord)
February.class: II (treated as feast of Our Lord)
February.office: Semi-festive Office; kept on Feb 2 even on Sunday (including Septuagesima, Sexagesima, Quinquagesima) without commemoration of Sunday

vespers.I_vespers: p.1355; retained only if Feb 2 is Sunday or where feast is I class (Compline on Feb 1 is of Sunday)

lesser_hours.hymns: Sunday #1; antiphons & psalms of weekday (p.279A ff.); short lesson of the season; rest pp.1355, 1365
lesser_hours.if_pre_lent_sunday: If coincides with Septuagesima/Sexagesima/Quinquagesima Sunday: use antiphons as pp.1355 & 1365; at Prime use Sunday psalms 117, 118i, 118ii (p.225).

blessing_of_candles.before_prayer: Only Dominus vobiscum and Oremus are said

mass.note: At Mass following the procession, omit Judica, Confiteor with absolution, subsequent versicles, Aufer a nobis, and Oramus te.

February.feast: St. Cyril of Alexandria, Bishop, Confessor, Doctor
Apparition of Our Lady at Lourdes
Seven Holy Founders of the Servite Order, Confessors

lesser_hours.rest: Common of Confessor Bishop (pp.1174–1175), prayer Deus, qui beato Petro (p.1331)

February.commem_st_paul: At Mass & Vespers per general rule (p. LVIII); in Lent, precedes feria commem.

February.feast: St. Peter Damian, Bishop, Confessor, Doctor
St. Gabriel of Our Lady of Sorrows, Confessor

March.feast: St. Joseph, Spouse of the BVM, Confessor, Patron of the Universal Church
March.general: All as pp.1400–1407 except as below

prime.mass_commem: Commemoration of feria at every Mass

lesser_hours.hymns: Melody of the season or solemn-feast Sunday melodies

vespers.if_saturday: Vespers of feast with commemoration of Sunday; Compline of Sunday
vespers.if_sunday: Feast transferred to Monday; on Sunday: Vespers of Sunday with commemoration of feast (ant. Exsurges Joseph p.1402; v. Constituit; prayer Sanctissimae)

March.general: All as pp.1414–1418 except as below

lesser_hours.hymns: Melody of the season or solemn-feast Sunday melodies

vespers.if_saturday: Vespers of feast with commemoration of Sunday; Compline of Sunday
vespers.if_sunday_non_palm: Transferred to Monday; on Sunday: Vespers of Sunday with commemoration of feast (ant. Spiritus sanctus p.1414; v. Ave Maria p.1417; prayer Deus, qui de beatae p.1415)
vespers.if_palm_week: If on Palm Sunday or during Holy Week, transferred to Monday after Low Sunday (follows beyond provided text).

April.feast: St. Leo I, Pope, Confessor, Doctor

April.mass: Si diligis me p.1122¹ with collect p.1431

April.special: Where I class: Festive Office from Common p.1141, with Creed

April.vespers: Common p.1120 with prayer Deus qui beato p.1432

April.mass: Si diligis me p.1122¹ with prayer p.1432

April.feast: St. Paul of the Cross, Confessor

May.notes: Commemoration of Sunday at Lauds, both Vespers, all Masses

May.feast: Feria (or Ss. Alexander, Eventius & Theodulus, Martyrs, and St. Juvenal, Bishop Confessor)
St. Gregory Nazianzen, Bishop, Confessor, Doctor

May.notes: If I class: Festive Office; commemoration of Sunday at Vespers & Masses

May.feast: Ss. Nereus, Achilleus, Domitilla (V.) & Pancras, Martyrs
St. Robert Bellarmine, Bishop, Confessor, Doctor
St. John Baptist de la Salle, Confessor
St. Bede the Venerable, Confessor, Doctor
St. Mary Magdalen de Pazzi, Virgin
Feria (or St. Felix I, Pope, Martyr)

May.notes: No I Vespers; hymns #1 of Sunday at lesser Hours; Prime short lesson of season; conventual Mass commemorates St. Petronilla

June.feast: Feria (or Ss. Marcellinus, Peter & Erasmus, Martyrs)
St. John of San Facundo, Confessor
St. Anthony of Padua, Confessor, Doctor
St. Basil the Great, Bishop, Confessor, Doctor
Feria (or Ss. Vitus, Modestus & Crescentia, Martyrs)
St. Ephraem the Syrian, Deacon, Confessor, Doctor

June.commemoration: of martyrs if conventual; where Ss. Gervase & Protase are I/II class, use Common of Martyrs p.1153, Creed if I class

June.feast: Nativity of St. John the Baptist
June.notes: Prime short lesson of season; Creed at Mass; commemoration of Sunday at Lauds, Vespers, Masses; Compline of Sunday on 23 & 24
Prime short lesson of season; commemoration of Sunday at Lauds, Vespers, Masses
At all Masses commemoration of St. Peter only; if I class: Festive with Creed, commemoration of St. Peter & Sunday

details.lesser_hours: Antiphons and psalms of weekday (p. 279A ff.), rest from Proper (pp. 1304, 1307)
details.if_saturday: Vespers of Sunday without commemoration of feast; Compline of Saturday

if_class_I.lesser_hours: Antiphons from pp. 1304, 1307 with psalms of Sunday (Prime n° III)
if_class_I.vespers_II: Proper p. 1307, even on Saturday, with commemoration of Sunday (ant. Ecce nomen Domini, p. 317; vers. Rorate; prayer Excita, p. 326)
if_class_I.if_sunday: Feast transferred to Monday; on Sunday only commemoration (ant. Unus ex duobus, p. 1304; vers. In omnem terram, p. 1303; prayer Majestatem, p. 1305)

2.name: St. Bibiana, V.M.
2.mass: Me exspectaverunt, p. 1220 except collect p. 1309

3.name: St. Francis Xavier, Conf.
3.if_missions: Principal patron of the Missions, I class; Festive Office; all from Common of Conf. not Bishop (p. 1193) except prayer p. 1310; transfer rules for Sunday or Saturday

4.name: St. Peter Chrysologus, Bp. Conf. Doct.
4.mass: p. 1311, no Creed; commemoration of St. Barbara if conventual

7.name: St. Ambrose, Bp. Conf. Doct.
7.if_class_I: Festive Office; all from Common Conf. Bishop (p. 1173); Creed at Mass; Vespers with commemoration of following only

details.lesser_hours: Hymns to Advent melody (or of solemn feasts) with common doxology; at Prime short lesson of Advent
details.if_sunday: Office and Mass of feast; commemoration of Sunday at Lauds, both Vespers, and all Masses
details.if_saturday: II Vespers of feast with commemoration of Sunday (p. 327)
details.if_sunday_before: On Dec. 7, Vespers of Sunday with commemoration of feast (ant. Beata me dicent, p. 1313; vers. Immaculata Conceptio, p. 1321; prayer Deus, qui per Immaculatam, p. 1317)
details.at_mass: Commemoration of feria at every Mass

11.name: St. Damasus I, Pope and Conf.
11.mass: Si diligis me, p. 1221, common preface

13.name: St. Lucy, V.M.
13.mass: Liber Usualis pp. 1323-1325, no Creed; I Vespers only if feast is I class

details.commemoration: Of feria at all Masses and Vespers
details.if_sunday: Feast not kept or commemorated; only transferred if it is I class

feasts_december.24-jan13: See Proper of Time p. LXXII

_meta.notes: Merged by ChatGPT from user-provided month JSONs; structure normalized to {proper_of_saints:{intro, months:{Month:[entries]}}}.

July.feast: The Most Precious Blood of Our Lord
July.notes: No commemoration of the occurring Sunday at Lauds, either Vespers, or at Mass; Prime short lesson of the season.

July.feast: Visitation of the B. V. Mary
July.notes: At lesser Hours hymns no. 1 of Sunday; antiphons and psalms of the occurring weekday; Prime short lesson of season. If I class: commemoration at Precious Blood Vespers; little Hours antiphons proper with Sunday psalms (Prime no. III).

July.vespers: Ants./pss. of weekday; chap. Ecce sacerdos (p.1177); hymn/versicle/Magnificat antiphon p.1551.
Weekday psalms; chap. Mulierem fortem (p.1233); hymn as in Common; versicle Ora pro nobis (p.1553); Magnificat antiphon & prayer follow.

July.feast: The Seven Holy Brothers, Martyrs, and Ss. Rufina & Secunda, Virgins, Martyrs

July.notes: If conventual, commemoration of Ss. Martyrs.

July.feast: Commemoration of Our Lady of Mount Carmel
July.notes: If on Saturday, Mass may be of Our Lady on Saturday or the proper Mass.

July.mass: Os iusti p.1200 (proper epistle); gospel of Abbots p.1208

July.notes: If conventual, commemoration of Ss. Martyrs.
If conventual, commemoration of St. Margaret.

July.feast: St. Lawrence of Brindisi, Confessor & Doctor
July.notes: If conventual, commemoration of St. Praxedes (Dilexisti p.1225).

July.vespers: Weekday psalms; chap. Mulierem (p.1233); hymn p.1565; versicle & Magnificat ant. p.1568; prayer from Mass.
July.notes: If I class: Festive Office; little Hours antiphons from Common (p.1232) with Sunday psalms; Mass p.1566 with Creed; II Vespers from Common; Compline of Sunday both days.
If conventual, commemoration of St. Liborius.

July.feast: Commemoration of St. Christina, Virgin & Martyr

July.vespers: Common p.1114 (prayer p.1570); Saturday add commemoration of Sunday.
July.notes: Little Hours: weekday psalms; rest from Common pp.1112–1113 (prayer p.1570). If I class: I & II Vespers from Common; little Hours from Common; Prime short lesson of season; Mass without commem. of the Martyr; Compline of Sunday both days; commemoration of Sunday at both Vespers and Masses.

July.feast: St. Anne, Mother of the B. V. Mary
July.vespers: Common p.1232 (prayer p.1571; Sat. commem. of Sunday)
July.notes: Little Hours: weekday psalms; rest from Common p.1232; If I class: all Hours from Common; commemoration of Sunday at both Vespers and Masses.

July.feast: Ss. Nazarius & Celsus, Martyrs; Victor I, Pope, Martyr; Innocent I, Pope, Confessor

July.notes: If conventual, commemoration of Ss. Martyrs.

July.feast: Commemoration of Ss. Abdon & Sennen, Martyrs

August.feast: Commemoration of the Holy Machabees, Martyrs
St. Alphonsus Mary de Liguori, Bishop, Confessor & Doctor
August.notes: If conventual, commemoration of St. Stephen I, Pope, Martyr.

August.feast: Dedication of the Church of St. Mary of the Snow
August.notes: Little Hours & Compline: hymns no.1 of Sunday; weekday psalms; rest from Common p.1256. Vespers: weekday psalms; rest from Common p.1259. On Saturday: I Vespers of following (p.1584) without commem. of Sunday/preceding; Compline of Sunday (hymn no.1).

Feast of Our Lord. Little Hours: hymns no.1 of Sunday; weekday psalms; rest proper; Prime short lesson of season. At conventual weekday Mass: commemoration of Ss. Sixtus II (Pope), Felicissimus, Agapitus (prayers from Sapientiam p.1166); omit if I class. On Sunday: no commemoration; Preface of Holy Trinity; weekday: common Preface.
If conventual, commemoration of St. Donatus. Vespers Magnificat antiphon Quaerite primum (p.1591).
If conventual, commemoration of Ss. Cyriacus, Largus & Smaragdus (Aug 8).
If conventual, commemoration of St. Romanus.

Little Hours: weekday psalms; rest proper pp.1593 & 1596; Prime short lesson of season. If I class: include I Vespers (p.1593); Mass with Creed; commemoration of Sunday at both Vespers; Compline of Sunday both days.

August.feast: Commemoration of Ss. Tiburtius & Susanna, Martyrs
August.mass: Salus autem p.1169; prayers p.1598; epistle Sancti per fidem p.1336

August.feast: Commemoration of Ss. Hippolytus & Cassian, Martyrs

August.notes: If conventual, commemoration of St. Eusebius.

August.feast: Assumption of the B. V. Mary
August.notes: Compline & lesser Hours: hymns no.2 of Sunday; Prime short lesson of season. At both Vespers, Lauds, and sung Mass: commemoration of Sunday if it occurs.

August.feast: St. Joachim, Father of the B. V. Mary, Confessor
August.notes: Little Hours: weekday psalms; rest from Common pp.1194–1195 (prayer p.1608). Weekday Mass common Preface; Sunday Mass Preface of the Trinity.

August.mass: Laetabitur p.1138; prayers p.1611; gospel Amen, amen, dico vobis p.1354v

August.feast: St. Jane Frances de Chantal, Widow

August.vespers: Common p.1258 (Magnificat ant. p.1612; prayer p.16121; Sat. commemoration of Sunday)
August.notes: Little Hours: hymns no.1 of Sunday; weekday psalms; rest from Common pp.1255 ff.; Prime short lesson of season.

August.vespers: Common p.1114 (prayer from Mass; Sat. commemoration of Sunday)
August.notes: Little Hours: weekday psalms; rest from Common pp.1112–1113. If I class: Festive Office with commemoration of Sunday at both Vespers & Masses.

August.feast: Commemoration of St. Zephyrinus, Pope & Martyr

August.notes: If conventual, commemoration of St. Hermes.

August.feast: Beheading of St. John the Baptist
August.notes: Little Hours: weekday psalms; rest from Common of a Martyr pp.1124–1125; prayer from Mass. If I class: Festive with I & II Vespers; little Hours antiphons 1,2,3,5 of Vespers with Sunday psalms; Mass with Creed; commemoration of Sunday at both Vespers & Mass.
If conventual, commemoration of Ss. Martyrs.

source: Liber Usualis (1961) – Proper of the Saints (Sep–Nov) per user transcription
